AccountStatus.title: AccountStatus
AccountStatus.description:
Account Status.

This status is read only and is calcuated to suggest special states that can be relayed
to the end user or manager views. Status's include when a user is new, the user has been
reset or pasword needs to be set.

CodeMessage.title: CodeMessage
CodeMessage.description:
A generic code and message response model.

Args:
    BaseModel (class): Base pydantic model

address-callback-number.title: Address-Callback-Number
address-callback-number.description: This will match the callback number

address-name.title: Address-Name
address-name.description: This is the name label for the address

caller-name.title: Caller-Name
caller-name.description: This is the caller's name for the address

address-line-1.title: Address-Line-1
address-line-1.description: This is the address line 1 for the address

address-line-2.title: Address-Line-2
address-line-2.description: This is the address line 2 for the address

address-city.title: Address-City
address-city.description: This is the city for the address

address-state-province-abbreviation.title: Address-State-Province-Abbreviation
address-state-province-abbreviation.description: This is the state or province (Canadian) abbreviation for the address

address-postal-code.title: Address-Postal-Code
address-postal-code.description: This is the postal code for the address

address-country-abbreviation.title: Address-Country-Abbreviation
address-country-abbreviation.description: This is the country abbreviation for the address

address-location-description.title: Address-Location-Description
address-location-description.description: This is an optional location description for the address

carrier.title: Carrier
carrier.description: This is the carrier name for the address

location-id.title: Location-Id
location-id.description: This is the address-id in cases for creation using an existing address. For create/update either location-id or address-formatted-pidflo is needed

CreateAddressEndpoint.description:
Model to create a new endpoint address.

Args:
    CreateAddress (class): The base create address model

CreateDevice.title: CreateDevice

synchronous.title: Synchronous
synchronous.description:
When synchronous is requested with "yes" the response will be a 200 on success and will contain a valid JSON representation of the new resource.
            If no or left off request a 202 "Accepted" will be given in a success case and this can be considered a success. Synchronous responses will be a
            little slower as the API will process the geo replication request and wait till the local copy has been written and can be read back before
            sending a response.

device-sip-registration-password.title: Device-Sip-Registration-Password
device-sip-registration-password.description:
This is the password which would be used for device registration. If left unset on device create it will create a new random password with a
            default length of 16 characters.

caller-id-number-emergency.title: Caller-Id-Number-Emergency
caller-id-number-emergency.description: This is a override value for emergency caller id value that would be specific to this device and would override the user's set value.

device-force-notify-new-voicemails-enabl.title: Device-Force-Notify-New-Voicemails-Enabled
device-force-notify-new-voicemails-enabl.description: This settings will control if the the parent feature is enabled.

device-level-call-recording-enabled.title: Device-Level-Call-Recording-Enabled
device-level-call-recording-enabled.description: This settings will control if the the parent feature is enabled.

device-push-enabled.title: Device-Push-Enabled
device-push-enabled.description:
When enabled this rule is available to be user though it may not be active as the timeframe might not match the current time or there
            could be other higher priority timeframes.

device-sip-registration-expiry-seconds.title: Device-Sip-Registration-Expiry-Seconds
device-sip-registration-expiry-seconds.description:
This is the requested re-register period for the device. The device will be treated as unregistered if they do not register in this
            window + a system wide grace period

device-sip-registration-ignore-for-prese.title: Device-Sip-Registration-Ignore-For-Presence-Calculation
device-sip-registration-ignore-for-prese.description: This settings will control if the the parent feature is enabled.

device-sip-registration-ignore-report-en.title: Device-Sip-Registration-Ignore-Report-Enabled
device-sip-registration-ignore-report-en.description: This settings will control if the the parent feature is enabled.

device-sip-no-to-tag-in-cancel.title: Device-Sip-No-To-Tag-In-Cancel
device-sip-no-to-tag-in-cancel.description: This settings will control if the the parent feature is enabled.

device-srtp-enabled.title: Device-Srtp-Enabled
device-srtp-enabled.description: This setting will enable SRTP (secure/encrypted audio) on the the device.

auto-answer-enabled.title: Auto-Answer-Enabled
auto-answer-enabled.description: This settings will control if the the parent feature is enabled.

recording-configuration.title: Recording-Configuration
recording-configuration.description: Option whether to record calls or not. Available options are "yes", "yes-with-transcription", "yes-with-transcription-and-sentiment", or "no"

device-sip-allowed-user-agent.title: Device-Sip-Allowed-User-Agent
device-sip-allowed-user-agent.description:
This value can be used to restrict registration to a specific User Agent or partial match of User Agent. This allows for an extra layer of
            security if you know the expected user agent.

device-sip-nat-traversal-enabled.title: Device-Sip-Nat-Traversal-Enabled
device-sip-nat-traversal-enabled.description: This is the main nat transveral setting. In most all device cases "automatic" is the correct answer.

emergency-address-id.title: Emergency-Address-Id
emergency-address-id.description: This value if set will be the address-id specific to this device for emergency calling

device-models-model.title: Device-Models-Model
device-models-model.description:
This is an optional model that when provided with device-provisioning-mac-address will link this device to the mac address in the device
            provisioning platform.

device-provisioning-mac-address.title: Device-Provisioning-Mac-Address
device-provisioning-mac-address.description:
This is the mac address that has this device linked to it. This field can be used to link a mac address on device create.
            Must also provide a device-models-model

device-provisioning-registration-core-se.title: Device-Provisioning-Registration-Core-Server
device-provisioning-registration-core-se.description: This is the SiPbx Servers primary server config from a list of valid.

device-provisioning-sip-transport-protoc.title: Device-Provisioning-Sip-Transport-Protocol
device-provisioning-sip-transport-protoc.description: This is the transport that will be requested when provisioning the device.

device-provisioning-username.title: Device-Provisioning-Username
device-provisioning-username.description: The provisioning username for the request to authenticate the configuration request.

device-provisioning-password.title: Device-Provisioning-Password
device-provisioning-password.description: The provisioning password for the request to authenticate the configuration request.

device-provisioning-line.title: Device-Provisioning-Line
device-provisioning-line.description: Optional setting to select which line is used on the device when provisioned with device-models-model and device-provisioning-mac-address.

device-provisioning-overrides.title: Device-Provisioning-Overrides
device-provisioning-overrides.description: This is the overrides set for the mac address in the provisioning server on the mac linked to this device.

device.title: Device
device.description: This is the "device" id which will be the first part of the device-sip-registration-uri which can be used to read specific device information.

CreateDevice.description:
Model to use for creating a new device within netsapiens.

Args:
    Device (Enum): The base device model

CreateDomain.title: CreateDomain

domain.title: Domain
domain.description: This is the domain that the token will be limited to.

reseller.title: Reseller
reseller.description: This is the reseller that owns this domain. Must be a valid reseller name on creation.

description.title: Description
description.description:
This is a description of the domain. This will be shown in many places to help show a
        more user friendly version of the domain to help identify it.

music-on-hold-enabled.title: Music-On-Hold-Enabled
music-on-hold-enabled.description: Enabled will trigger music on hold for the domain and allow it to be customized.

music-on-ring-enabled.title: Music-On-Ring-Enabled
music-on-ring-enabled.description: Enabled will trigger music on hold for the domain and allow it to be customized.

music-on-hold-randomized-enabled.title: Music-On-Hold-Randomized-Enabled
music-on-hold-randomized-enabled.description: Enabled will trigger music on hold for the domain and allow it to be customized.

domain-type.title: Domain-Type
domain-type.description:
Allows a special domain type to be set for specific use cases. Currently Residential and
            Hospitality are options which will limit and effect the users experience.

dial-plan.title: Dial-Plan
dial-plan.description:
This is the default dial plan that will be used for new users created in the domain. A
            dial plan is created by default on new domain creation with a name matching the domain.

dial-policy.title: Dial-Policy
dial-policy.description:
This is the default dial policy (permission) that will be used for new users added ot the
            domain. Generally these are system wide policies and will not need to create one per
            domain.

email-send-from-address.title: Email-Send-From-Address
email-send-from-address.description:
This is the email source that will be used when sending out emails for this domain. This
            address should be configured properly through the email server so that emails are not
            blocked. In most cases this is recommended to be an address on the service providers or
            resellers hostname so DNS SPF records can be added on the hostname to prevent spam
            issues.  More info on SPF records available via https://www.cloudflare.com/learning/dns/dns-records/dns-spf-record/

single-sign-on-enabled.title: Single-Sign-On-Enabled
single-sign-on-enabled.description: Enabled will trigger music on hold for the domain and allow it to be customized.

area-code.title: Area-Code
area-code.description:
The default area code for the domain. This is used by default on 7 digit dials to extent
            the number to a valid 10 digit number.

caller-id-name.title: Caller-Id-Name
caller-id-name.description: This is the main caller id name for the user to be used for outbound calls outside of the domain.

caller-id-number.title: Caller-Id-Number
caller-id-number.description: This is the main caller id number for the user to be used for outbound calls outside of the domain.

caller-id-number-emergency.title: Caller-Id-Number-Emergency
caller-id-number-emergency.description: This is the main caller id that will be used for emergency calls when placed by the user.

limits-max-subcriber-resources-total.title: Limits-Max-Subcriber-Resources-Total
limits-max-subcriber-resources-total.description:
This is the maximum number of subscribers allowed for domain including the subscribers
            that would be created as part of resources like call queues and auto attendants. If
            looking to limit normal users it would be better to use limits-max-users

limits-max-active-calls-total.title: Limits-Max-Active-Calls-Total
limits-max-active-calls-total.description:
This is the limit for the number of active calls allowed in the domain simultaneously.
            Note: this will count and limit intra domain calls.

limits-max-active-calls-offnet.title: Limits-Max-Active-Calls-Offnet
limits-max-active-calls-offnet.description: This is the limit for the number of active calls allowed in the domain simultaneously that are connected to offnet or external numbers.

limits-max-call-queues.title: Limits-Max-Call-Queues
limits-max-call-queues.description: This is the maximum number of call queues that would be allowed to be created in this domain.

limits-max-auto-attendants.title: Limits-Max-Auto-Attendants
limits-max-auto-attendants.description: This is the maximum number of auto attendants that would be allowed to be created in this domain.

limits-max-conferences.title: Limits-Max-Conferences
limits-max-conferences.description: This is the maximum number of conference bridges that would be allowed to be created in this domain.

limits-max-departments.title: Limits-Max-Departments
limits-max-departments.description: This is the maximum number of departments that would be allowed to be created in this domain.

limits-max-users.title: Limits-Max-Users
limits-max-users.description: This is the maximum number of regular users that would be allowed to be created in this domain.

limits-max-sites.title: Limits-Max-Sites
limits-max-sites.description: This is the maximum number of sites that would be allowed to be created in this domain.

limits-max-fax-accounts.title: Limits-Max-Fax-Accounts
limits-max-fax-accounts.description: This is the maximum number of fax accounts that would be allowed to be created in this domain.

time-zone.title: Time-Zone
time-zone.description: The timezone which the meeting was created with

email-send-smtp-hostname.title: Email-Send-Smtp-Hostname
email-send-smtp-hostname.description:
This is the SMTP server hostname. SMTP server configs are NOT required at domain level as
            they will inherit reseller or system level as needed.

email-send-smtp-port.title: Email-Send-Smtp-Port
email-send-smtp-port.description:
This is the SMTP port for sending emails. SMTP server configs are NOT required at domain
            level as they will inherit reseller or system level as needed.

email-send-smtp-username.title: Email-Send-Smtp-Username
email-send-smtp-username.description:
This is the username used in connecting to SMTP  server for sending email. SMTP server
            configs are NOT required at domain level as they will inherit reseller or system level as
            needed.

email-send-smtp-password.title: Email-Send-Smtp-Password
email-send-smtp-password.description:
This is the password used in connecting to SMTP  server for sending email. SMTP server
            configs are NOT required at domain level as they will inherit reseller or system level as
            needed.

active-calls-total-current.title: Active-Calls-Total-Current
active-calls-total-current.description:
This is the total active calls for the domain including on-net (intra domain) calls and
            calls across geo servers and calls linked to "guest" video sessions

active-calls-against-license-count.title: Active-Calls-Against-License-Count
active-calls-against-license-count.description:
This is the total active calls for the domain including on-net (intra domain) calls but
    counted as the license would be enforced including ignoring geo call legs and guest video
    sessions.

active-calls-offnet-current.title: Active-Calls-Offnet-Current
active-calls-offnet-current.description:
This is the total active calls for the domain only including calls that are connected to
            a remote (non intra domain) caller/calling party.

count-subcriber-resources-total.title: Count-Subcriber-Resources-Total
count-subcriber-resources-total.description: This is the total number of users plus all the system users as well for the entire domain.

emergency-address-id.title: Emergency-Address-Id
emergency-address-id.description: Value will need to be an exact match to an address-id which links to a address for DLR (dynamic location routing) for emergency calling

voicemail-enabled.title: Voicemail-Enabled
voicemail-enabled.description: Enabled will allow storage of voicemails.

recording-configuration.title: Recording-Configuration
recording-configuration.description: Option whether to record calls or not.

voicemail-transcription-enabled.title: Voicemail-Transcription-Enabled
voicemail-transcription-enabled.description: Enable this setting and select a vendor if you wish to have voicemails transcribed after a voicemail is recorded.

language-token.title: Language-Token
language-token.description: This is the language that is set for the user to be used for portal viewing.

phonenumber.title: Phonenumber
phonenumber.description:
This is the main phonenumber setting. Should be a  formatted in a e164 format with country
        count and number. US domestic numbers should be similar to 18005551234

enabled.title: Enabled
enabled.description: This allows any added configurations to specify a hostname.

domain.title: Domain
domain.description: This is the domain that the token will be limited to.

dial-rule-application.title: Dial-Rule-Application
dial-rule-application.description:
This is the application that the call will be routed using.
            It works in partnership with dial-rule-translation-destination-user
            and dial-rule-translation-destination-host to forward to a next destination.

dial-rule-parameter.title: Dial-Rule-Parameter
dial-rule-parameter.description: This is the application parameter field that can be used for additional settings based on the dial-rule-application.

dial-rule-translation-destination-user.title: Dial-Rule-Translation-Destination-User
dial-rule-translation-destination-user.description:
This is the forward destination the call will be sent to in partnership with the
            application (dial-rule-application) and host (dial-rule-translation-destination-host).
            This might be a user, queue or offnet number depending on the application.

dial-rule-translation-destination-host.title: Dial-Rule-Translation-Destination-Host
dial-rule-translation-destination-host.description: This is the application parameter field that can be used for additional settings based on the dial-rule-application.

dial-rule-translation-source-name.title: Dial-Rule-Translation-Source-Name
dial-rule-translation-source-name.description:
This field will allow customization of the source "name" often used for teh caller id
            name or the the descriptive quoted value outside of the sip uri. Defaults to [*] but you
            can add a prefix for example with something like this, sales_[*]

dial-rule-description.title: Dial-Rule-Description
dial-rule-description.description: This is a description of the number/rule that can be used for definition or tracking purposes.

This is the login for the user used to access the portals and other applications. The
            default will be [user]@[domain] if not set otherwise.  This value is required to be
            unique across the entire system so 409 will be returned if not unique.

            dial plan is created by default on new domain creation with a name matching the domain.

            domain. Generally these are system wide policies and will not need to create one per
            domain.

limits-max-data-storage-kilobytes.description: This is the maximum value in kilobytes that is allowed to be stored in the user's voicemail, audio greetings and fax storage.

domain.title: Domain
domain.description: This is the domain that the token will be limited to.

user.title: User
user.description: This is the main user extension for the user account.

name-first-name.title: Name-First-Name
name-first-name.description: This is the first name for the user

name-last-name.title: Name-Last-Name
name-last-name.description: This is the last name for the user

login-username.title: Login-Username
login-username.description:
This is the login for the user used to access the portals and other applications. The
            default will be [user]@[domain] if not set otherwise.  This value is required to be
            unique across the entire system so 409 will be returned if not unique.

email.title: Email
email.description: This is the email address or list of email addresses separated with a semi-colon.

user-scope.description:
This is the scope that should be enforced in combination with the reseller, domain and
            user fields. It will be set using the scope used to create the subscription.

department.title: Department
department.description:
This is the department that user belongs to in the domain.
        Can be any string to group users, a department is not require
        to be setup before in order to set it for a user.

site.title: Site
site.description:
This is the site or location for this user. The site will group users that are at the same physical location,
        but can be used for other grouping purposes as well. New users will inherit some settings from the site if the
        site was previously setup. If the site is not previously created then a new site will be created with the value
        given on new user create assuming the domain's max sites setting has remaining sites.

time-zone.title: Time-Zone
time-zone.description: The timezone which the user is in

voicemail-login-pin.title: Voicemail-Login-Pin
voicemail-login-pin.description: This is the numeric pin that would be used by the user validating their account when connecting into voice IVR to check voicemail.

dial-plan.title: Dial-Plan
dial-plan.description:
This is the default dial plan that will be used for new users created in the domain. A
            dial plan is created by default on new domain creation with a name matching the domain.

dial-policy.title: Dial-Policy
dial-policy.description:
This is the default dial policy (permission) that will be used for new users added ot the
            domain. Generally these are system wide policies and will not need to create one per
            domain.

status-message.title: Status-Message
status-message.description:
This is is a value that is often set by the end user to show their current status,
            often a away message of some kind.

user-presence-status.title: User-Presence-Status
user-presence-status.description: This is a read only presence status for the user that will be calculated by the core system based on registration, answer rules and active call status.

directory-name-number-dtmf-mapping.title: Directory-Name-Number-Dtmf-Mapping
directory-name-number-dtmf-mapping.description:
This is a 3 digit numeric mapping that correlates to the first 3 digits of a user's
            first or last name for dial by name directory. Example Smith would be "764" translating
            the letters to numbers using the normal phone number mappings.

voicemail-user-control-enabled.title: Voicemail-User-Control-Enabled
voicemail-user-control-enabled.description: This allows any added configurations to specify a hostname.

phone-numbers-to-allow-enabled.title: Phone-Numbers-To-Allow-Enabled
phone-numbers-to-allow-enabled.description: This allows any added configurations to specify a hostname.

phone-numbers-to-reject-enabled.title: Phone-Numbers-To-Reject-Enabled
phone-numbers-to-reject-enabled.description: This allows any added configurations to specify a hostname.

call-screening-enabled.title: Call-Screening-Enabled
call-screening-enabled.description: This allows any added configurations to specify a hostname.

ring-no-answer-timeout-seconds.title: Ring-No-Answer-Timeout-Seconds
ring-no-answer-timeout-seconds.description:
This time setting in seconds will control how long a inbound call attempt will attempt
            to connect the call before stopping and attempting the next option which might be a
            forward setting in answer rules or voicemail if enabled.

language-token.title: Language-Token
language-token.description: This is the language that is set for the user to be used for portal viewing.

limits-max-active-calls-total.title: Limits-Max-Active-Calls-Total
limits-max-active-calls-total.description:
This is the limit for the number of active calls allowed in the domain simultaneously.
            Note: this will count and limit intra domain calls.

directory-override-order-duplicate-dtmf-.title: Directory-Override-Order-Duplicate-Dtmf-Mapping
directory-override-order-duplicate-dtmf-.description:
This value can be used in cases where multiple users have the same value for
            directory-name-number-dtmf-mapping, if they are the same then use this setting
            to set the order low to high for playback in dial by name directory menu.

voicemail-greeting-index.title: Voicemail-Greeting-Index
voicemail-greeting-index.description:
This is the index of the greeting that is enabled currently for the user.
            Greeting 0 is the generic "[name] is not available" message will be played.

voicemail-receive-broadcast-enabled.title: Voicemail-Receive-Broadcast-Enabled
voicemail-receive-broadcast-enabled.description: This allows any added configurations to specify a hostname.

email-send-alert-new-voicemail-cc-list-c.title: Email-Send-Alert-New-Voicemail-Cc-List-Csv
email-send-alert-new-voicemail-cc-list-c.description: This list of user's which will be forward copies of new voicemails left on that user.

email-send-alert-new-voicemail-behavior.title: Email-Send-Alert-New-Voicemail-Behavior
email-send-alert-new-voicemail-behavior.description:
This is the behavior that the voicemail logic will take after a voicemail is left.
           The options include ability to send with attachments or hyperlinks.

email-send-alert-new-voicemail-enabled.title: Email-Send-Alert-New-Voicemail-Enabled
email-send-alert-new-voicemail-enabled.description: Send email alert on new voicemail.

email-send-alert-new-missed-call-enabled.title: Email-Send-Alert-New-Missed-Call-Enabled
email-send-alert-new-missed-call-enabled.description: Send email alert on missed call.

email-send-alert-data-storage-limit-reac.title: Email-Send-Alert-Data-Storage-Limit-Reached-Enabled
email-send-alert-data-storage-limit-reac.description: Send email alert on data storage limit reached.

caller-id-number.title: Caller-Id-Number
caller-id-number.description: This is the main caller id number for the user to be used for outbound calls outside of the domain.

caller-id-name.title: Caller-Id-Name
caller-id-name.description: This is the main caller id name for the user to be used for outbound calls outside of the domain.

caller-id-number-emergency.description: This is the main caller id that will be used for emergency calls when placed by the user.

area-code.title: Area-Code
area-code.description: This is a area code for the user. I will be used when user dial's 7 digits to translate it to full 10 or 11 digit number.

service-code.title: Service-Code
service-code.description:
Service codes are for internal use that allow user's to be tagged for billing and tracking purposes.
            Any service code starting with "system-" will be hidden by default in the portals and not count as regular users.

voicemail-transcription-enabled.title: Voicemail-Transcription-Enabled
voicemail-transcription-enabled.description: Enable this setting and select a vendor if you wish to have voicemails transcribed after a voicemail is recorded.

emergency-address-id.title: Emergency-Address-Id
emergency-address-id.description: Value will need to be an exact match to an address-id which links to a address for DLR (dynamic location routing) for emergency calling

music-on-hold-comfort-message-repeat-int.title: Music-On-Hold-Comfort-Message-Repeat-Interval-Seconds
music-on-hold-comfort-message-repeat-int.description: This interval will control how frequently the music on hold would be interupted and have messages played. Should be used when using music on hod and custom messages.

active-calls-total-current.title: Active-Calls-Total-Current
active-calls-total-current.description: This read only setting is the current active call count for this user.

recording-configuration.title: Recording-Configuration
recording-configuration.description: Option whether to record calls or not. Available options are "yes", "yes-with-transcription", "yes-with-transcription-and-sentiment", or "no"

account-status.title: Account-Status
account-status.description:
This status is read only and is calculated to suggest special states that can be relayed
            to the end user or manager views. Status's include when a user is new, the user has been
            reset or password needs to be set.

created-datetime.title: Created-Datetime
created-datetime.description: This datetime is when the user was created.

last-modified-datetime.title: Last-Modified-Datetime
last-modified-datetime.description: This datetime is when the user was last modified.

music-on-ring-enabled.description: Enabled will trigger music on hold for the domain and allow it to be customized.

music-on-hold-randomized-enabled.title: Music-On-Hold-Randomized-Enabled
music-on-hold-randomized-enabled.description: Enabled will trigger music on hold for the domain and allow it to be customized.

domain-type.title: Domain-Type
domain-type.description:
Allows a special domain type to be set for specific use cases. Currently Residential and
            Hospitality are options which will limit and effect the users experience.

dial-plan.title: Dial-Plan
dial-plan.description:
This is the default dial plan that will be used for new users created in the domain. A
            dial plan is created by default on new domain creation with a name matching the domain.

dial-policy.title: Dial-Policy
dial-policy.description:
This is the default dial policy (permission) that will be used for new users added ot the
            domain. Generally these are system wide policies and will not need to create one per
            domain.

email-send-from-address.title: Email-Send-From-Address
email-send-from-address.description:
This is the email source that will be used when sending out emails for this domain. This
            address should be configured properly through the email server so that emails are not
            blocked. In most cases this is recommended to be an address on the service providers or
            resellers hostname so DNS SPF records can be added on the hostname to prevent spam
            issues.  More info on SPF records available via https://www.cloudflare.com/learning/dns/dns-records/dns-spf-record/

single-sign-on-enabled.title: Single-Sign-On-Enabled
single-sign-on-enabled.description: Enabled will trigger music on hold for the domain and allow it to be customized.

area-code.title: Area-Code
area-code.description:
The default area code for the domain. This is used by default on 7 digit dials to extent
            the number to a valid 10 digit number.

caller-id-name.title: Caller-Id-Name
caller-id-name.description: This is the main caller id name for the user to be used for outbound calls outside of the domain.

caller-id-number.title: Caller-Id-Number
caller-id-number.description: This is the main caller id number for the user to be used for outbound calls outside of the domain.

caller-id-number-emergency.title: Caller-Id-Number-Emergency
caller-id-number-emergency.description: This is the main caller id that will be used for emergency calls when placed by the user.

limits-max-subcriber-resources-total.title: Limits-Max-Subcriber-Resources-Total
limits-max-subcriber-resources-total.description:
This is the maximum number of subscribers allowed for domain including the subscribers
            that would be created as part of resources like call queues and auto attendants. If
            looking to limit normal users it would be better to use limits-max-users

limits-max-active-calls-total.title: Limits-Max-Active-Calls-Total
limits-max-active-calls-total.description:
This is the limit for the number of active calls allowed in the domain simultaneously.
            Note: this will count and limit intra domain calls.

limits-max-active-calls-offnet.title: Limits-Max-Active-Calls-Offnet
limits-max-active-calls-offnet.description: This is the limit for the number of active calls allowed in the domain simultaneously that are connected to offnet or external numbers.

limits-max-call-queues.title: Limits-Max-Call-Queues
limits-max-call-queues.description: This is the maximum number of call queues that would be allowed to be created in this domain.

limits-max-auto-attendants.title: Limits-Max-Auto-Attendants
limits-max-auto-attendants.description: This is the maximum number of auto attendants that would be allowed to be created in this domain.

limits-max-conferences.title: Limits-Max-Conferences
limits-max-conferences.description: This is the maximum number of conference bridges that would be allowed to be created in this domain.

limits-max-departments.title: Limits-Max-Departments
limits-max-departments.description: This is the maximum number of departments that would be allowed to be created in this domain.

limits-max-users.title: Limits-Max-Users
limits-max-users.description: This is the maximum number of regular users that would be allowed to be created in this domain.

limits-max-sites.title: Limits-Max-Sites
limits-max-sites.description: This is the maximum number of sites that would be allowed to be created in this domain.

limits-max-fax-accounts.title: Limits-Max-Fax-Accounts
limits-max-fax-accounts.description: This is the maximum number of fax accounts that would be allowed to be created in this domain.

time-zone.title: Time-Zone
time-zone.description: The timezone which the meeting was created with

email-send-smtp-hostname.title: Email-Send-Smtp-Hostname
email-send-smtp-hostname.description:
This is the SMTP server hostname. SMTP server configs are NOT required at domain level as
            they will inherit reseller or system level as needed.

email-send-smtp-port.title: Email-Send-Smtp-Port
email-send-smtp-port.description:
This is the SMTP port for sending emails. SMTP server configs are NOT required at domain
            level as they will inherit reseller or system level as needed.

email-send-smtp-username.title: Email-Send-Smtp-Username
email-send-smtp-username.description:
This is the username used in connecting to SMTP  server for sending email. SMTP server
            configs are NOT required at domain level as they will inherit reseller or system level as
            needed.

email-send-smtp-password.title: Email-Send-Smtp-Password
email-send-smtp-password.description:
This is the password used in connecting to SMTP  server for sending email. SMTP server
            configs are NOT required at domain level as they will inherit reseller or system level as
            needed.

active-calls-total-current.title: Active-Calls-Total-Current
active-calls-total-current.description:
This is the total active calls for the domain including on-net (intra domain) calls and
            calls across geo servers and calls linked to "guest" video sessions

active-calls-against-license-count.title: Active-Calls-Against-License-Count
active-calls-against-license-count.description:
This is the total active calls for the domain including on-net (intra domain) calls but
    counted as the license would be enforced including ignoring geo call legs and guest video
    sessions.

active-calls-offnet-current.title: Active-Calls-Offnet-Current
active-calls-offnet-current.description:
This is the total active calls for the domain only including calls that are connected to
            a remote (non intra domain) caller/calling party.

count-subcriber-resources-total.title: Count-Subcriber-Resources-Total
count-subcriber-resources-total.description: This is the total number of users plus all the system users as well for the entire domain.

emergency-address-id.title: Emergency-Address-Id
emergency-address-id.description: Value will need to be an exact match to an address-id which links to a address for DLR (dynamic location routing) for emergency calling

voicemail-enabled.title: Voicemail-Enabled
voicemail-enabled.description: Enabled will allow storage of voicemails.

recording-configuration.title: Recording-Configuration
recording-configuration.description: Option whether to record calls or not.

voicemail-transcription-enabled.title: Voicemail-Transcription-Enabled
voicemail-transcription-enabled.description: Enable this setting and select a vendor if you wish to have voicemails transcribed after a voicemail is recorded.

language-token.title: Language-Token
language-token.description: This is the language that is set for the user to be used for portal viewing.

DomainType.title: DomainType
DomainType.description:
Domain Type.

Allows a special domain type to be set for specific use cases. Currently Residential and
Hospitality are options which will limit and effect the users experience.

EmailSendAlertNewVoicemailBehavior.title: EmailSendAlertNewVoicemailBehavior
EmailSendAlertNewVoicemailBehavior.description:
Email Send Alert New Voicemail Behavior.

This is the behavior that the voicemail logic will take after a voicemail is left. The
options include ability to send with attachments or hyperlinks.

PhoneNumber.title: PhoneNumber

phonenumber.title: Phonenumber
phonenumber.description:
This is the main phonenumber setting. Should be a  formatted in a e164 format with country
        count and number. US domestic numbers should be similar to 18005551234

enabled.title: Enabled
enabled.description: This allows any added configurations to specify a hostname.

domain.title: Domain
domain.description: This is the domain that the token will be limited to.

dial-rule-application.title: Dial-Rule-Application
dial-rule-application.description:
This is the application that the call will be routed using.
            It works in partnership with dial-rule-translation-destination-user
            and dial-rule-translation-destination-host to forward to a next destination.

dial-rule-parameter.title: Dial-Rule-Parameter
dial-rule-parameter.description: This is the application parameter field that can be used for additional settings based on the dial-rule-application.

dial-rule-translation-destination-user.title: Dial-Rule-Translation-Destination-User
dial-rule-translation-destination-user.description:
This is the forward destination the call will be sent to in partnership with the
            application (dial-rule-application) and host (dial-rule-translation-destination-host).
            This might be a user, queue or offnet number depending on the application.

dial-rule-translation-destination-host.title: Dial-Rule-Translation-Destination-Host
dial-rule-translation-destination-host.description: This is the application parameter field that can be used for additional settings based on the dial-rule-application.

dial-rule-translation-source-name.title: Dial-Rule-Translation-Source-Name
dial-rule-translation-source-name.description:
This field will allow customization of the source "name" often used for teh caller id
            name or the the descriptive quoted value outside of the sip uri. Defaults to [*] but you
            can add a prefix for example with something like this, sales_[*]

dial-rule-description.title: Dial-Rule-Description
dial-rule-description.description: This is a description of the number/rule that can be used for definition or tracking purposes.

PhoneNumber.description:
Model of a PhoneNumber.

Args:
    BaseModel (class): Base pydantic model

RecordingConfiguration.title: RecordingConfiguration
RecordingConfiguration.description:
Recording Configuration.

Option whether to record calls or not. Available options are "yes", "yes-with-transcription",
"yes-with-transcription-and-sentiment", or "no".

Scopes.title: Scopes
Scopes.description:
Scopes.

This is the scope that should be enforced in combination with the reseller, domain and
user fields. it will be set using the scope used to create the subscription.

Scopes, Will link this resource with a User Scope granting it certain permissions to the
system for use in API and Portal.

SipTransportProtocol.title: SipTransportProtocol
SipTransportProtocol.description:
Sip Transport Protocol.

This is the transport that will be requested when provisioning the device.

address-location-description.description: This is an optional location description for the address

carrier.description: This is the carrier name for the address

UpdateDevice.title: UpdateDevice

synchronous.title: Synchronous
synchronous.description:
When synchronous is requested with "yes" the response will be a 200 on success and will contain a valid JSON representation of the new resource.
            If no or left off request a 202 "Accepted" will be given in a success case and this can be considered a success. Synchronous responses will be a
            little slower as the API will process the geo replication request and wait till the local copy has been written and can be read back before
            sending a response.

device-sip-registration-password.title: Device-Sip-Registration-Password
device-sip-registration-password.description:
This is the password which would be used for device registration. If left unset on device create it will create a new random password with a
            default length of 16 characters.

caller-id-number-emergency.title: Caller-Id-Number-Emergency
caller-id-number-emergency.description: This is a override value for emergency caller id value that would be specific to this device and would override the user's set value.

device-force-notify-new-voicemails-enabl.title: Device-Force-Notify-New-Voicemails-Enabled
device-force-notify-new-voicemails-enabl.description: This settings will control if the the parent feature is enabled.

device-level-call-recording-enabled.title: Device-Level-Call-Recording-Enabled
device-level-call-recording-enabled.description: This settings will control if the the parent feature is enabled.

device-push-enabled.title: Device-Push-Enabled
device-push-enabled.description:
When enabled this rule is available to be user though it may not be active as the timeframe might not match the current time or there
            could be other higher priority timeframes.

device-sip-registration-expiry-seconds.title: Device-Sip-Registration-Expiry-Seconds
device-sip-registration-expiry-seconds.description:
This is the requested re-register period for the device. The device will be treated as unregistered if they do not register in this
            window + a system wide grace period

device-sip-registration-ignore-for-prese.title: Device-Sip-Registration-Ignore-For-Presence-Calculation
device-sip-registration-ignore-for-prese.description: This settings will control if the the parent feature is enabled.

device-sip-registration-ignore-report-en.title: Device-Sip-Registration-Ignore-Report-Enabled
device-sip-registration-ignore-report-en.description: This settings will control if the the parent feature is enabled.

device-sip-no-to-tag-in-cancel.title: Device-Sip-No-To-Tag-In-Cancel
device-sip-no-to-tag-in-cancel.description: This settings will control if the the parent feature is enabled.

device-srtp-enabled.title: Device-Srtp-Enabled
device-srtp-enabled.description: This setting will enable SRTP (secure/encrypted audio) on the the device.

auto-answer-enabled.title: Auto-Answer-Enabled
auto-answer-enabled.description: This settings will control if the the parent feature is enabled.

recording-configuration.title: Recording-Configuration
recording-configuration.description: Option whether to record calls or not. Available options are "yes", "yes-with-transcription", "yes-with-transcription-and-sentiment", or "no"

device-sip-allowed-user-agent.title: Device-Sip-Allowed-User-Agent
device-sip-allowed-user-agent.description:
This value can be used to restrict registration to a specific User Agent or partial match of User Agent. This allows for an extra layer of
            security if you know the expected user agent.

device-sip-nat-traversal-enabled.title: Device-Sip-Nat-Traversal-Enabled
device-sip-nat-traversal-enabled.description: This is the main nat transveral setting. In most all device cases "automatic" is the correct answer.

emergency-address-id.title: Emergency-Address-Id
emergency-address-id.description: This value if set will be the address-id specific to this device for emergency calling

device-models-model.title: Device-Models-Model
device-models-model.description:
This is an optional model that when provided with device-provisioning-mac-address will link this device to the mac address in the device
            provisioning platform.

device-provisioning-mac-address.title: Device-Provisioning-Mac-Address
device-provisioning-mac-address.description:
This is the mac address that has this device linked to it. This field can be used to link a mac address on device create.
            Must also provide a device-models-model

device-provisioning-registration-core-se.title: Device-Provisioning-Registration-Core-Server
device-provisioning-registration-core-se.description: This is the SiPbx Servers primary server config from a list of valid.

device-provisioning-sip-transport-protoc.title: Device-Provisioning-Sip-Transport-Protocol
device-provisioning-sip-transport-protoc.description: This is the transport that will be requested when provisioning the device.

device-provisioning-username.title: Device-Provisioning-Username
device-provisioning-username.description: The provisioning username for the request to authenticate the configuration request.

device-provisioning-password.title: Device-Provisioning-Password
device-provisioning-password.description: The provisioning password for the request to authenticate the configuration request.

device-provisioning-line.title: Device-Provisioning-Line
device-provisioning-line.description: Optional setting to select which line is used on the device when provisioned with device-models-model and device-provisioning-mac-address.

device-provisioning-overrides.title: Device-Provisioning-Overrides
device-provisioning-overrides.description: This is the overrides set for the mac address in the provisioning server on the mac linked to this device.

Model to use for updating a device within netsapiens.

Args:
    Device (Enum): the base device model

UpdatePhoneNumber.title: UpdatePhoneNumber

phonenumber.title: Phonenumber
phonenumber.description:
This is the main phonenumber setting. Should be a  formatted in a e164 format with country
        count and number. US domestic numbers should be similar to 18005551234

enabled.title: Enabled
enabled.description: This allows any added configurations to specify a hostname.

domain.title: Domain
domain.description: This is the domain that the token will be limited to.

dial-rule-application.title: Dial-Rule-Application
dial-rule-application.description:
This is the application that the call will be routed using.
            It works in partnership with dial-rule-translation-destination-user
            and dial-rule-translation-destination-host to forward to a next destination.

dial-rule-parameter.title: Dial-Rule-Parameter
dial-rule-parameter.description: This is the application parameter field that can be used for additional settings based on the dial-rule-application.

dial-rule-translation-destination-user.title: Dial-Rule-Translation-Destination-User
dial-rule-translation-destination-user.description:
This is the forward destination the call will be sent to in partnership with the
            application (dial-rule-application) and host (dial-rule-translation-destination-host).
            This might be a user, queue or offnet number depending on the application.

dial-rule-translation-destination-host.title: Dial-Rule-Translation-Destination-Host
dial-rule-translation-destination-host.description: This is the application parameter field that can be used for additional settings based on the dial-rule-application.

dial-rule-translation-source-name.title: Dial-Rule-Translation-Source-Name
dial-rule-translation-source-name.description:
This field will allow customization of the source "name" often used for teh caller id
            name or the the descriptive quoted value outside of the sip uri. Defaults to [*] but you
            can add a prefix for example with something like this, sales_[*]

dial-rule-description.title: Dial-Rule-Description
dial-rule-description.description: This is a description of the number/rule that can be used for definition or tracking purposes.

UpdatePhoneNumber.description:
Update a phone number.

Args:
    PhoneNumber (class): Base phone number

UpdateSite.title: UpdateSite

login-username.title: Login-Username
login-username.description:
This is the login for the user used to access the portals and other applications. The
            default will be [user]@[domain] if not set otherwise.  This value is required to be
            unique across the entire system so 409 will be returned if not unique.

time-zone.title: Time-Zone
time-zone.description: The timezone which the user is in

dial-plan.title: Dial-Plan
dial-plan.description:
This is the default dial plan that will be used for new users created in the domain. A
            dial plan is created by default on new domain creation with a name matching the domain.

dial-policy.title: Dial-Policy
dial-policy.description:
This is the default dial policy (permission) that will be used for new users added ot the
            domain. Generally these are system wide policies and will not need to create one per
            domain.

voicemail-user-control-enabled.title: Voicemail-User-Control-Enabled
voicemail-user-control-enabled.description: This allows any added configurations to specify a hostname.

phone-numbers-to-allow-enabled.title: Phone-Numbers-To-Allow-Enabled
phone-numbers-to-allow-enabled.description: This allows any added configurations to specify a hostname.

phone-numbers-to-reject-enabled.title: Phone-Numbers-To-Reject-Enabled
phone-numbers-to-reject-enabled.description: This allows any added configurations to specify a hostname.

call-screening-enabled.title: Call-Screening-Enabled
call-screening-enabled.description: This allows any added configurations to specify a hostname.

language-token.title: Language-Token
language-token.description: This is the language that is set for the user to be used for portal viewing.

limits-max-data-storage-kilobytes.title: Limits-Max-Data-Storage-Kilobytes
limits-max-data-storage-kilobytes.description: This is the maximum value in kilobytes that is allowed to be stored in the user's voicemail, audio greetings and fax storage.

limits-max-active-calls-total.title: Limits-Max-Active-Calls-Total
limits-max-active-calls-total.description:
This is the limit for the number of active calls allowed in the domain simultaneously.
            Note: this will count and limit intra domain calls.

directory-annouce-in-dial-by-name-enable.title: Directory-Annouce-In-Dial-By-Name-Enabled
directory-annouce-in-dial-by-name-enable.description: This allows any added configurations to specify a hostname.

voicemail-receive-broadcast-enabled.title: Voicemail-Receive-Broadcast-Enabled
voicemail-receive-broadcast-enabled.description: This allows any added configurations to specify a hostname.

caller-id-number.title: Caller-Id-Number
caller-id-number.description: This is the main caller id number for the user to be used for outbound calls outside of the domain.

caller-id-name.title: Caller-Id-Name
caller-id-name.description: This is the main caller id name for the user to be used for outbound calls outside of the domain.

caller-id-number-emergency.title: Caller-Id-Number-Emergency
caller-id-number-emergency.description: This is the main caller id that will be used for emergency calls when placed by the user.

area-code.title: Area-Code
area-code.description: This is a area code for the user. I will be used when user dial's 7 digits to translate it to full 10 or 11 digit number.

emergency-address-id.title: Emergency-Address-Id
emergency-address-id.description: Value will need to be an exact match to an address-id which links to a address for DLR (dynamic location routing) for emergency calling

active-calls-total-current.title: Active-Calls-Total-Current
active-calls-total-current.description: This read only setting is the current active call count for this user.

recording-configuration.title: Recording-Configuration
recording-configuration.description: Option whether to record calls or not. Available options are "yes", "yes-with-transcription", "yes-with-transcription-and-sentiment", or "no"

created-datetime.title: Created-Datetime
created-datetime.description: This datetime is when the user was created.

last-modified-datetime.title: Last-Modified-Datetime
last-modified-datetime.description: This datetime is when the user was last modified.

UpdateUser.title: UpdateUser

domain.title: Domain
domain.description: This is the domain that the token will be limited to.

user.title: User
user.description: This is the main user extension for the user account.

name-first-name.title: Name-First-Name
name-first-name.description: This is the first name for the user

name-last-name.title: Name-Last-Name
name-last-name.description: This is the last name for the user

login-username.title: Login-Username
login-username.description:
This is the login for the user used to access the portals and other applications. The
            default will be [user]@[domain] if not set otherwise.  This value is required to be
            unique across the entire system so 409 will be returned if not unique.

email.title: Email
email.description: This is the email address or list of email addresses separated with a semi-colon.

user-scope.title: User-Scope
user-scope.description:
This is the scope that should be enforced in combination with the reseller, domain and
            user fields. It will be set using the scope used to create the subscription.

department.title: Department
department.description:
This is the department that user belongs to in the domain.
        Can be any string to group users, a department is not require
        to be setup before in order to set it for a user.

site.title: Site
site.description:
This is the site or location for this user. The site will group users that are at the same physical location,
        but can be used for other grouping purposes as well. New users will inherit some settings from the site if the
        site was previously setup. If the site is not previously created then a new site will be created with the value
        given on new user create assuming the domain's max sites setting has remaining sites.

time-zone.title: Time-Zone
time-zone.description: The timezone which the user is in

voicemail-login-pin.title: Voicemail-Login-Pin
voicemail-login-pin.description: This is the numeric pin that would be used by the user validating their account when connecting into voice IVR to check voicemail.

dial-plan.title: Dial-Plan
dial-plan.description:
This is the default dial plan that will be used for new users created in the domain. A
            dial plan is created by default on new domain creation with a name matching the domain.

dial-policy.title: Dial-Policy
dial-policy.description:
This is the default dial policy (permission) that will be used for new users added ot the
            domain. Generally these are system wide policies and will not need to create one per
            domain.

status-message.title: Status-Message
status-message.description:
This is is a value that is often set by the end user to show their current status,
            often a away message of some kind.

user-presence-status.title: User-Presence-Status
user-presence-status.description: This is a read only presence status for the user that will be calculated by the core system based on registration, answer rules and active call status.

directory-name-number-dtmf-mapping.title: Directory-Name-Number-Dtmf-Mapping
directory-name-number-dtmf-mapping.description:
This is a 3 digit numeric mapping that correlates to the first 3 digits of a user's
            first or last name for dial by name directory. Example Smith would be "764" translating
            the letters to numbers using the normal phone number mappings.

voicemail-user-control-enabled.title: Voicemail-User-Control-Enabled
voicemail-user-control-enabled.description: This allows any added configurations to specify a hostname.

phone-numbers-to-allow-enabled.title: Phone-Numbers-To-Allow-Enabled
phone-numbers-to-allow-enabled.description: This allows any added configurations to specify a hostname.

phone-numbers-to-reject-enabled.title: Phone-Numbers-To-Reject-Enabled
phone-numbers-to-reject-enabled.description: This allows any added configurations to specify a hostname.

call-screening-enabled.title: Call-Screening-Enabled
call-screening-enabled.description: This allows any added configurations to specify a hostname.

ring-no-answer-timeout-seconds.title: Ring-No-Answer-Timeout-Seconds
ring-no-answer-timeout-seconds.description:
This time setting in seconds will control how long a inbound call attempt will attempt
            to connect the call before stopping and attempting the next option which might be a
            forward setting in answer rules or voicemail if enabled.

language-token.title: Language-Token
language-token.description: This is the language that is set for the user to be used for portal viewing.

limits-max-active-calls-total.title: Limits-Max-Active-Calls-Total
limits-max-active-calls-total.description:
This is the limit for the number of active calls allowed in the domain simultaneously.
            Note: this will count and limit intra domain calls.

directory-override-order-duplicate-dtmf-.title: Directory-Override-Order-Duplicate-Dtmf-Mapping
directory-override-order-duplicate-dtmf-.description:
This value can be used in cases where multiple users have the same value for
            directory-name-number-dtmf-mapping, if they are the same then use this setting
            to set the order low to high for playback in dial by name directory menu.

voicemail-greeting-index.title: Voicemail-Greeting-Index
voicemail-greeting-index.description:
This is the index of the greeting that is enabled currently for the user.
            Greeting 0 is the generic "[name] is not available" message will be played.

voicemail-receive-broadcast-enabled.title: Voicemail-Receive-Broadcast-Enabled
voicemail-receive-broadcast-enabled.description: This allows any added configurations to specify a hostname.

email-send-alert-new-voicemail-cc-list-c.title: Email-Send-Alert-New-Voicemail-Cc-List-Csv
email-send-alert-new-voicemail-cc-list-c.description: This list of user's which will be forward copies of new voicemails left on that user.

email-send-alert-new-voicemail-behavior.title: Email-Send-Alert-New-Voicemail-Behavior
email-send-alert-new-voicemail-behavior.description:
This is the behavior that the voicemail logic will take after a voicemail is left.
           The options include ability to send with attachments or hyperlinks.

email-send-alert-new-voicemail-enabled.title: Email-Send-Alert-New-Voicemail-Enabled
email-send-alert-new-voicemail-enabled.description: Send email alert on new voicemail.

email-send-alert-new-missed-call-enabled.title: Email-Send-Alert-New-Missed-Call-Enabled
email-send-alert-new-missed-call-enabled.description: Send email alert on missed call.

email-send-alert-data-storage-limit-reac.title: Email-Send-Alert-Data-Storage-Limit-Reached-Enabled
email-send-alert-data-storage-limit-reac.description: Send email alert on data storage limit reached.

caller-id-number.title: Caller-Id-Number
caller-id-number.description: This is the main caller id number for the user to be used for outbound calls outside of the domain.

caller-id-name.title: Caller-Id-Name
caller-id-name.description: This is the main caller id name for the user to be used for outbound calls outside of the domain.

caller-id-number-emergency.title: Caller-Id-Number-Emergency
caller-id-number-emergency.description: This is the main caller id that will be used for emergency calls when placed by the user.

area-code.title: Area-Code
area-code.description: This is a area code for the user. I will be used when user dial's 7 digits to translate it to full 10 or 11 digit number.

service-code.title: Service-Code
service-code.description:
Service codes are for internal use that allow user's to be tagged for billing and tracking purposes.
            Any service code starting with "system-" will be hidden by default in the portals and not count as regular users.

voicemail-transcription-enabled.title: Voicemail-Transcription-Enabled
voicemail-transcription-enabled.description: Enable this setting and select a vendor if you wish to have voicemails transcribed after a voicemail is recorded.

emergency-address-id.title: Emergency-Address-Id
emergency-address-id.description: Value will need to be an exact match to an address-id which links to a address for DLR (dynamic location routing) for emergency calling

music-on-hold-comfort-message-repeat-int.title: Music-On-Hold-Comfort-Message-Repeat-Interval-Seconds
music-on-hold-comfort-message-repeat-int.description: This interval will control how frequently the music on hold would be interupted and have messages played. Should be used when using music on hod and custom messages.

active-calls-total-current.title: Active-Calls-Total-Current
active-calls-total-current.description: This read only setting is the current active call count for this user.

recording-configuration.title: Recording-Configuration
recording-configuration.description: Option whether to record calls or not. Available options are "yes", "yes-with-transcription", "yes-with-transcription-and-sentiment", or "no"

account-status.title: Account-Status
account-status.description:
This status is read only and is calculated to suggest special states that can be relayed
            to the end user or manager views. Status's include when a user is new, the user has been
            reset or password needs to be set.

created-datetime.title: Created-Datetime
created-datetime.description: This datetime is when the user was created.

last-modified-datetime.title: Last-Modified-Datetime
last-modified-datetime.description: This datetime is when the user was last modified.

Update a user.

    User (class): Base user
